text: Why Paul Smith’s College? It’s about the experience.
Find your fit at Paul Smith’s College and learn how you can apply.
Explore costs and aid, including scholarships and grants.

It is our desire to help you transition from high school, a community college, the military or from overseas. We want to get to know you and your family, answer all your questions and support your efforts to discover Paul Smith’s College.

RaiseMe helps 9-12th grade students prepare for college by earning scholarships for their achievements. Paul Smith’s College has partnered with RaiseMe, and awards micro-scholarships for both academics and extracurricular activities.
Students at PSC experience a hands-on education that combines proven career training with a meaningful exploration of self, society and the earth. Sounds like you? Let's connect!

Paul Smith’s College operates on what is called a “rolling admissions” process, meaning we accept applications on a continuous basis throughout the year. There is no May 1
The easiest and most affordable way to apply is online. There is no application fee if you apply

for the fall or spring semesters. Once we receive your application, we will begin looking for the other documents we need to complete your application. The most important being your high school transcript.
Once you complete your application, please visit your high school guidance office and request that they send us your high school transcript. For your convenience, feel free to use
. Letters of Recommendation and a personal statement are encouraged for all applications, but not required.
The SAT/ACT tests are not required
Once your application is complete a decision is usually made within two weeks. If you are mailing in references, transcripts or personal statements, please submit materials to:
